current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To provide for conditions on the renewal of  health insurance plans purchased through Exchanges.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Heath Care Consumer Choices Preservation Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Heath Care Consumer Choices Preservation Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Conditions on renewal of health plans purchased through exchanges

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a qualified health plan purchased by an individual
			 through an American Health Benefit Exchange for plan year 2014 shall not
			 be automatically renewed
			 with respect to such individual for plan year 2015 unless—

the plan premium for plan year 2015 is the same as the plan premium for plan year 2014;
			 or
the individual requests such automatic renewal of the plan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 36B of the
			 Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
A plan may be automatically renewed as described in subsection (a)(1) only if the cost of the
			 premium to  the individual would
			 be the same for  plan year 2015 as for plan year 2014, before and
			 after application of a premium assistance credit under

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2801 IS: Heath Care Consumer Choices Preservation Act

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
